reasoning: Reporting incidence of symptomatic EBV infection (infectious mononucleosis). Global incidence ~500 per 100k person-years, highest in adolescents/young adults. Most infections are asymptomatic.
source: Ebell MH. (2004). Epstein-Barr virus infectious mononucleosis. Am Fam Physician. 70(7):1279-1287
